subtitleNullable: Annotated Image Dataset for Cataract Detection and Classification, Preprocessed
descriptionNullable:
# Description:
This dataset comprises 410 annotated images categorized into two classes: immature and mature cataracts. Each image has undergone preprocessing and augmentation to enhance its suitability for machine learning tasks.

# Preprocessing:
The images were preprocessed using the following steps:

- Auto-orientation of pixel data, with EXIF-orientation stripping, to ensure consistency in orientation across images.
- Resizing to 416x416 pixels, facilitating uniformity in image dimensions.
Augmentation:
- To increase the diversity of the dataset and improve model robustness, each source image was augmented by introducing salt and pepper noise, affecting 5% of the pixels. This augmentation technique helps in simulating real-world variations and enhancing the model's ability to generalize to unseen data.

# Annotation:
Cataract annotations are provided in folder format, allowing easy access to categorized images for training, validation, and testing purposes.
title: Cataract Classification Dataset
subtitle: Annotated Image Dataset for Cataract Detection and Classification, Preprocessed
description:
# Description:
This dataset comprises 410 annotated images categorized into two classes: immature and mature cataracts. Each image has undergone preprocessing and augmentation to enhance its suitability for machine learning tasks.

# Preprocessing:
The images were preprocessed using the following steps:

- Auto-orientation of pixel data, with EXIF-orientation stripping, to ensure consistency in orientation across images.
- Resizing to 416x416 pixels, facilitating uniformity in image dimensions.
Augmentation:
- To increase the diversity of the dataset and improve model robustness, each source image was augmented by introducing salt and pepper noise, affecting 5% of the pixels. This augmentation technique helps in simulating real-world variations and enhancing the model's ability to generalize to unseen data.

# Annotation:
Cataract annotations are provided in folder format, allowing easy access to categorized images for training, validation, and testing purposes.
